name: MSCRMPluginRegistration
author: Wael Hamze
helpMarkDown: Upsert plugin/workflow assembly, types and steps

inputs.name: registrationType
inputs.label: Registration Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Reset: Deletes assembly/types/steps and re-creates everything. Upsert: Updates/Creates existing assembly/types/steps and creates if not present.

inputs.name: assemblyPath
inputs.label: Assembly path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of assembly to be register.

inputs.name: isWorkflowActivityAssembly
inputs.label: Is Workflow Activity Assembly?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true for assemblies that contain workflow activities

inputs.name: solutionName
inputs.label: CRM solution name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Unique name of solution to which plugin/workflow assembly has to be register.

inputs.name: mappingJsonPath
inputs.label: Mapping Json Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Plugin registration json mapping used to register assembly/types/steps.</br> Mapping json file sample can be found here: https://github.com/WaelHamze/xrm-ci-framework/blob/master/MSDYNV9/Xrm.Framework.CI/Xrm.Framework.CI.PowerShell.Cmdlets/PluginRegistration/PluginRegistrationMappingExample.json. </br> JSON schema which will help you to generate plugin registration mapping can be found here: https://github.com/WaelHamze/xrm-ci-framework/blob/master/MSDYNV9/Xrm.Framework.CI/Xrm.Framework.CI.PowerShell.Cmdlets/PluginRegistration/PluginRegistrationMappingSchema.json. </br> How to use schema can be found here: https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/webdev/2014/04/10/intellisense-for-json-schema-in-the-json-editor/. </br> To generate plugin registration JSON mapping from existing assembly/type/steps from a specific solution, please use cmdlet: https://github.com/WaelHamze/xrm-ci-framework/blob/master/MSDYNV9/Xrm.Framework.CI/Xrm.Framework.CI.PowerShell.Scripts/GetPluginRegistrationJsonMapping.ps1 </br>

inputs.name: crmConnectionTimeout
inputs.label: Crm Connection Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Crm connection timeout in seconds
